III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Four months ago, a staff member made an inappropriate
comment about a youth's body in front of the youth and another
youth. On another unknown date, another staff member sexually
assaulted an unknown youth. The perpetrating staff member was
discussing the assault with another staff member in front of a
youth two weeks ago.
Investigation Interviews
The following interviews were completed at Vista Maria on
1/30/2025 with DCWL Worker 2 and DHHS Specialist, unless
otherwise noted.
An interview was completed with Compliance. He reported Youth
A has been moved multiple times for fighting. He confirmed
someone named Staff 3 worked in DeRoy building. He also
confirmed there are two male staff that are brothers, Staff 1 and
Staff 2, that work at Vista Maria. Staff 1 works at DeRoy and Staff
2 works at Rose Hall. He denied there are any incident/complaint
reports regarding either of the brothers making any inappropriate
comments. Dan reported there is an open DHHS investigation
regarding Youth D engaging in oral sex with other youth at
Freedom Hall. He further confirmed that Staff 3 is off sick but
agreed to contact her by telephone to see if she is willing to be
interviewed. On 02/26/2025 an in-person interview was held with
Compliance. DHHS specialist was also present. He again
confirmed that there are no incident reports or video footage
associated with the allegations.
An interview was completed with Youth A. She has been at the
facility for 5 months, she is currently on green wing, however she
has had to be moved to different wings due to fighting with other
youths. She identified a male staff that works on her wing, Staff 1,
who has a twin brother that works in another building. She denied
any staff member has ever made any inappropriate or sexual
comments toward her. She denied witnessing any staff making
any sexual comments to another youth or witnessing any
2

inappropriate relationships between any staff or youth. She
reported having heard of sexual contact between youth only. She
heard from another peer, Youth D, who is in another building, that
there was an incident between Youth D and Youth E. Youth A
stated that Youth D told her she and Youth E went into the
bathroom on their wing and engaged in oral sex. Youth D told her
the staff was not aware what was going on. Youth A said she
heard from a staff member that Staff 3 and Staff 2 were talking
about a youth's butt being fat. Youth denied she witnessed either
of these incidents.
An interview was completed with Staff 1. He confirmed he works
at Deroy Hall. He denied ever making any comments to any youth
about having a "fat ass” or speaking to another staff about a
youth’s body. Staff 1 reported Youth A has made inappropriate
comments about his twin brother, Staff 2, who also works at Vista
Maria, and he wrote an incident report regarding the comments
she made. He reported that he believes he has written incident
reports regarding this in the past. He said Youth A made a
comment like she wants to be his sister-in-law. Staff 1 denied
witnessing or hearing about any youth engaging in sexual activity
with a staff member.
A phone interview was completed with Staff 3. She stated that
she is a youth coach and has been employed by Vista Maria since
October 2024. Staff 3 reported that last month she overheard a
conversation between Youth A and Youth C and they were talking
about Staff 4 being fired for sending inappropriate pictures to a
youth from a different building. She denied discussing or telling
Youth A anything about any staff or youth being involved in a
sexual relationship. She further denied having any conversations
with Youth A about inappropriate incidents.
On 02/06/2025 an email was sent to FCW requesting feedback
with any concerns regarding Youth A and her placement at Vista.
On 02/13/2025 an email was received from DHHS Specialist that
included myself and Compliance. A request was made for
documentation relevant to the investigation from Compliance. He
responded and advised there were no incident reports that
involved Youth A making comments about any staff, no incident
reports regarding staff members sending pictures to youth and no
additional incident reports regarding staff having sexual contact
with youth other than the ones already being investigated by
DHHS and DCWL.
3

The following interviews were completed at Vista Maria on
2/19/2025 with myself and DHHS Specialist, unless otherwise
noted.
An interview was completed with Youth E. She reported she is
currently placed in Rose Hall and has been there since her
placement in September 2024. She reported that she feels safe
around the male staff and they are very careful. She denied
having experienced any physical or sexual abuse and denied
knowledge of it occurring to other youth. She also denied any
knowledge of use of any illegal or inappropriate substances by
staff or other youth. Lastly, Youth E denied that she engaged in
any inappropriate activity with any youth in the facility, specifically
Youth D.
An interview was completed with Staff 2. He reported he is a
four-month employee and his primary work location is DeRoy Hall.
He denied making any inappropriate or sexual statements to any
youth at Vista Maria. He also denied hearing any staff or youth
making negative or inappropriate statements toward each other.
He denied knowledge of any staff engaging in the sexual assault
of youth at Vista Maria. Staff 2 specifically denied engaging in any
sexual activity with staff or youth. He denied seeing any other
staff be sexually inappropriate with staff or youth. He denied being
aware of Staff 3 but acknowledged that Staff 1 was his brother.
An interview was completed with Staff 4. He reported that he has
worked at the agency for two years and is a team leader on 2nd
shift. He stated he is usually assigned to Rose Hall. He denied
knowledge of any inappropriate sexual behavior between staff and
youth. He denied hearing any inappropriate sexual comments by
youth toward him or other staff. Staff 4 denied knowledge of any
staff requesting, receiving or engaging in oral sex with youth at
Vista Maria. Lastly, Staff 4 denied ever stating or hearing a staff
say that a youth at Vista has a “fat ass”.
The following interviews were completed at Vista Maria on
2/26/2025 with myself and DHHS Specialist, unless otherwise
noted.
An interview was completed with Youth C. She reported that she
has been at Vista Maria since April 2024. She reported that she
was previously at Deroy Hall and then was recently moved to
Miriam Hall. She reported hearing a rumor last year about a Staff
5 messing around with a youth but does not know if it is true. She
stated she did not believe it because she did not think Staff 5
4

would do anything like that. She stated that the rumor was that
the two were “messing around” because the youth was 18. She
identified the youth as Youth F, who has been discharged from the
program. Youth C reported that Staff 5 once brought in fidget
rings and gave them to youth to help them stay calm and focused.
Youth C denied ever hearing Staff 5 make any inappropriate
comments toward or about youth. Youth C denied having any
inappropriate contact with Staff 1 or Staff 2 or hearing of
inappropriate contact with other youth. She was familiar with both
staff and stated they were appropriate. Youth C reported having a
good relationship with Staff 3. She denied hearing or having
knowledge of Staff 3 making any inappropriate sexual contact with
youth. She was asked if she ever overheard any conversations
between staff that were of a sexual or otherwise inappropriate
nature and she denied it. She reported not feeling safe at Vista
Maria because the kids are always fighting and staff come in
drunk or high. When asked about the staff coming in under the
influence she stated when she was at Deroy, a female staff would
always come in high. Youth C stated her eyes were red, and she
would be falling asleep, and eating a lot. She also reported staff
would arrive to work smelling of marijuana.
An interview was completed with Youth G. She reported that she
has been in Deroy since October or November 2024 and has
been at Vista Maria since November 2023. Youth G reported that
she has never heard negative comments being made by Staff 1 or
Staff 2 but was told that negative comments were made by a staff
person at Rose Hall. She identified the staff person as Staff 8 and
stated the comments were about her. Youth G denied that Staff 1
or Staff 2 have ever touched her inappropriately and also denied
that she has heard either make inappropriate comments to youth.
She did acknowledge hearing youth make comments about Staff 2
because they find him attractive. Youth G denied hearing or
seeing any staff engage in inappropriate conversations with youth.
She denied that it's common for staff to talk with youth about
rumors or things going on with other youth.
An interview was completed with Youth H. She reported she has
been at Vista Maria since August 2024. She denied ever hearing
staff make inappropriate comments about youth or the bodies of
youth in the program. She further denied hearing any staff make
comments about a youth having a “fat ass”. Youth H was eager to
return to class and requested that the interview be completed.
She expressed no concerns with staff or their engagement with
youth.
5

An interview was completed with Staff 6 and Staff 7. Both staff
denied any knowledge of staff engaging in inappropriate contact
or making inappropriate comments about youth in the program.
They both specifically denied these allegations relative to Staff 1
and Staff 2.
On 02/28/2025 it was confirmed that special investigations
#2025SIC0000418, #2025SIC0000433 and #2025SIC0000455
were assigned to address concerns relative to inappropriate
contact between youth and staff, staff taking and sending
inappropriate pictures of youth and staff being under the influence
of substances.
On 2/28/2025 a Disposition Meeting was held. DHHS Specialist
facilitated the meeting and advised that there no findings relevant
to the allegations.
Documents Reviewed
Vista Maria HR file of Staff 1 - There is no disciplinary action in the
file of Staff 1.
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy - In order to promote
acceptable behavior at Vista Maria, employees are expected to
conduct themselves in a positive, professional and respectful
manner at all times in order to promote the therapeutic alliance
between the employee and the clients who are assigned into the
care of Vista Maria". The document indicates that Vista Maria
employee prohibited behaviors includes: "Engaging in any form of
sexual or other forms of harassing or bullying behavior", "abuse,
neglect or mismanagement of clients, co worker or visitor",
"immoral, violent or indecent conduct on Vista Maria property",
"giving or receiving gifts/items of value to or from clients without
immediate supervisor approval".
DHHS Specialist SW Contacts – On 2/28/2025 DHHS Specialist
completed telephone interviews with both Staff 8 and Staff 9.
Both denied any knowledge of staff making inappropriate
comments regarding youth at the agency or engaging in any
inappropriate contact with the youth. Both also denied engaging
in any conversations with youth regarding actions or behaviors of
other youth in the program.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rules. Both staff and youth were
interviewed and there was not sufficient evidence to support that
6

the staff failed to provide for the needs, protection and supervision
of the youth.
Technical Assistance
Agency was reminded of policy regarding staff bringing in items
without agency permission. Although ‘fidgets” were assessed to
be a positive tool for youth, agency permission should always be
obtained prior to sharing an object with youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
